snippet: Egypt’s military rulers declared Jan. 25 an official holiday to celebrate the anniversary of the uprising that ousted President Hosni Mubarak last year and recognize demonstrators killed during the protests.
abstract: Egypt’s military rulers declare Jan 25 an official holiday to celebrate the anniversary of the uprising that ousted President Hosni Mubarak in 2011 and recognize demonstrators killed during the protests.
lead_paragraph: Egypt’s military rulers declared Jan. 25 an official holiday to celebrate the anniversary of the uprising that ousted President Hosni Mubarak last year and recognize demonstrators killed during the protests.

headline.main: Egypt: Anti-Mubarak Uprising to Be Honored With Holiday
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Anti-Mubarak Uprising To Be Honored With Holiday
